title: 'Tsunami! Evacuate': Japan alerts revive memories of 2011 disaster

subhead: The legislation was approved in advance by the anti-corruption bodies and provides for regular lie detector tests for anti-graft officials.

subhead: The day after his world record, the French swimmer won the final of the 200m individual medley at the World Swimming Championships in Singapore on Thursday.

title: Dominique de Villepin: 'We have an absolute moral duty to oppose this murderous madness in Gaza'
subhead: The former French prime minister writes that to remain silent in the face of the horror unfolding in the Palestinian enclave is to be complicit, and that everyone has a duty to act and to name the crime taking place.

'White people shoot at us': Southern Brazil's Indigenous communities fight for ancestral land
subhead: In Mato Grosso do Sul, a southern state bordering Paraguay, Indigenous people who tried to reclaim the lands from which they had been dispossessed face violence from large landowners. The left-wing government largely remains powerless in the face of this tragedy.
byline: By Bruno Meyerfeld (Kurusu Amba, Dourados [Brazil], special correspondent)

title: In Brazil, the free and instant mobile payment system Pix challenges US dominance
subhead: Launched by the Central Bank of Brazil, this system is now used more than credit cards and cash. Its popularity is so great that WhatsApp had to abandon a payment system it wanted to launch locally.

title: 'I learned freedom at 34, and it was a revelation': Katja Lange-Müller, an eastern wind blows through West Berlin
subhead: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (3/6). Katja Lange-Müller, born in the German Democratic Republic (GDR), managed as an adult to cross 'to the other side' of the Wall, escaping her mother, a prominent member of the communist regime.
